reviews.review_msg: I took this course online distance as part of my PDP. Worst way to end a great program. The readings were boring and useless. Clarkson's commentary was the same. The course is boring and has a lame structure. If I could I would travel back in time and take ANY other course. Even EDUC Fingernails on chalkboard would have been more useful.

This guy is too smart for SFU.  He's knows a lot about everything and he's just awesome to talk to.  Assignments are super short, a couple of small assignments and an in class exam that he lets you writer whatever you want.  He lets you redo the page essays.  He's just awesome.
He is nice and generous prof.I recommend to attend class because the notes are helpful to get great marks on the essays!  Great class!

Jerry is a great guy, but his class is redudant. There is no real need to go to class, just read the relevent sections of the textbook and write 4 800 word essays; however, going to class and leaving at the break is also an option.
This course topic is interesting, but the professor is not.

Notes uploaded before class starts, no point in going. 4, 800 word essays to be summited online. chance to rewrite first two assignments but he does not tell you where you went wrong and just make you seek a peer tutor via SFU. 3 hour lecture is boring and worthless to attend. Just read textbook and notes to complete assignment.
Great Prof.  Loves the materials he covers.

Jerry will make you think and will challenge any thinking you may already have about Education (something not many profs do). Very fair marker (lets you re-write everything once, except for the final) and gives you feedback on your work. He tends to be long winded in answering questions in class and lectures can be a bit boring. Good overall.

Jerry is inspirational.  He's just an awesome prof.  Had him for EDUC 100, took it as an easy credit, and I thought the class was a cinch.  Ease aside though, take it for Jerry alone.  When he did not have me laughing (he's got a very comedic manner of teaching) he was provoking me to really THINK.  Few profs out there do this.  Highly recommended.
highly highly HIGHLY recommend this course. he was my favourite prof, I think every class at university should be like his classes. never boring,and always has a great answer to your questions
great class. great professor. He's super knowledgable, compassionate, caring, thoughtful. It's not an easy class, but it will get you thinking.
Great prof!  Great class!  Very understanding and helpful.  Highly recommended!
Distance ed class.  Jerry is great at responding to questions and provoking online discussion.  Overall, a good class.
